messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name: I will derive this data from the following paragraph: CASE NAME: The Riverside Riddle DATE: 11/15/46 Early one misty morning, a body was discovered floating by the riverside. The scene was secured and local law enforcement was called. LAW ENFORCEMENT ENGAGEMENT: CASE LEAD: Lieutenant A. B. Carter was assigned as the lead investigator of the case. With a sharp mind for detail, Lieutenant Carter quickly established a timeline of events. FORENSICS: Sergeant C. D. Evans and Technician E. F. Greene were appointed to collect and analyze any forensic evidence from the scene. INTERROGATION: Detective G. H. Irving and Officer I. J. Kelly conducted interviews with nearby residents and potential witnesses. INTEL: Deputy K. L. Mitchell is responsible for gathering intelligence regarding recent activities in the area and any known criminal elements. PATROL: Patrol Officers M. N. Oliver, O. P. Parker, and Q. R. Smith are in charge of maintaining a secure perimeter around the crime scene to ensure evidence preservation. LIAISON: Captain S. T. Underwood is liaising with other law enforcement agencies and the victim's family, coordinating efforts to solve the Riverside Riddle. ADDITIONAL DETAILS: A peculiar emblem was discovered at the scene which could potentially serve as a lead to unravel the Riverside Riddle. This emblem is currently being analyzed by the department.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: Lieutenant A. B. Carter 
Officer Context: Lieutenant Carter is the lead investigator for the Riverside Riddle case, known for their attention to detail in establishing timelines. 
Officer Role: Lieutenant 

Officer Name: Sergeant C. D. Evans 
Officer Context: Sergeant Evans is part of the forensics team, designated to collect and analyze evidence from the crime scene. 
Officer Role: Sergeant 

Officer Name: Technician E. F. Greene 
Officer Context: Technician Greene is also part of the forensics team, working alongside Sergeant Evans in evidence collection and analysis. 
Officer Role: Technician 

Officer Name: Detective G. H. Irving 
Officer Context: Detective Irving is in the interrogation team, responsible for interviewing nearby residents and potential witnesses. 
Officer Role: Detective 

Officer Name: Officer I. J. Kelly 
Officer Context: Officer Kelly is also in the interrogation team, working with Detective Irving in conducting interviews. 
Officer Role: Officer 

Officer Name: Deputy K. L. Mitchell 
Officer Context: Deputy Mitchell is in charge of gathering intelligence on recent area activities and identifying any known criminal elements. 
Officer Role: Deputy 

Officer Name: Patrol Officers M. N. Oliver, O. P. Parker, and Q. R. Smith 
Officer Context: These patrol officers are responsible for maintaining a secure perimeter around the crime scene for evidence preservation. 
Officer Role: Patrol Officers 

Officer Name: Captain S. T. Underwood 
Officer Context: Captain Underwood is the liaison officer, coordinating with other law enforcement agencies and the victim's family to solve the case. 
Officer Role: Captain
